alert.note: Alert for Allen; Simpson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 2:32AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Allen and Simpson. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 132 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scottsville, Franklin, Pope, Trammel, Mount Aerial, Red Hill, Alonzo, Butlersville, Clare and Chapel Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
